userPrompt: Help me launch a productivity app
agentReply: That's great! To launch a productivity app, you can start by brainstorming the key features you want in the app, creating a design mockup, and then developing the app either by yourself or with a team. What specific aspects of the productivity app are you interested in exploring further?

userPrompt: Help me create a mindfulness course
agentReply: That's a great idea! Let's break down the steps to help you create a mindfulness course.

suggestedBlocks.title: Mindfulness Course Creation Checklist
items: Define course objectives and goals
Create course outline and structure
Develop course content (videos, readings, exercises)
Design course materials (slides, handouts)
Decide on course delivery method (online, in-person)
Plan assessment methods (quizzes, assignments)
Set up a schedule for course sessions
Promote the course to potential participants

items.name: Course Planning Template
items.purpose: Helps organize course structure and content
items.recommended: Break down into modules and lessons

items.name: Assessment Tools Checklist
items.purpose: Lists options for evaluating participant progress
items.recommended: Mix of self-reflection and knowledge assessments

fields.label: What did you enjoy most about the course?
How can we improve the course?
Would you recommend this course to others?

agentReply: Starting a podcast is an exciting project! Let's break it down step by step to help you get started.

suggestedBlocks.title: Steps to Start a Podcast
items: Define your podcast concept and target audience
Choose a podcast name and format
Select podcast equipment (microphone, headphones, recording software)
Create podcast artwork and music intro
Record and edit your episodes
Choose a podcast hosting platform
Submit your podcast to directories like Apple Podcasts and Spotify
Promote your podcast through social media and other channels

items.name: Microphone
items.purpose: To capture high-quality audio for your episodes

items.name: Headphones
items.purpose: To monitor audio quality while recording and editing

items.name: Recording Software
items.purpose: To edit and enhance your podcast episodes

agentReply: Sure! To write an email to your professor, you may want to consider the following steps and tips:

suggestedBlocks.title: Email to Professor Checklist
items: Start with a polite greeting addressing the professor
Clearly state the purpose of your email
Be concise and to the point
Use a professional tone and formal language
Check for any grammar or spelling errors before sending
Sign off with a polite closing

items: 1. Define your book idea or concept
2. Create an outline or structure for your book
3. Start writing the first draft
4. Edit and revise your draft
5. Get feedback and make improvements
6. Finalize your manuscript

agentReply: Sure! Let's review your last prompt to see what you were working on.
Creating a podcast involves several steps, from planning to recording to publishing. Here are some key tasks and resources to help you get started:

suggestedBlocks.title: Podcast Creation Checklist
items: Define your podcast concept and target audience
Create a content calendar for episodes
Gather necessary equipment like microphones, headphones, and recording software
Write scripts or outlines for episodes
Record and edit your podcast episodes
Choose a hosting platform for your podcast
Publish and promote your podcast episodes

items.name: Microphone
items.purpose: Capture high-quality audio for your podcast recordings

items.name: Recording Software
items.purpose: Edit and enhance your podcast audio files

items.name: Hosting Platform
items.purpose: Distribute and share your podcast episodes

agentReply: Great! Let's brainstorm and craft a compelling podcast question. Here are some steps to guide you:

suggestedBlocks.title: Steps to Write a Podcast Question
items: Define the theme or topic of your podcast episode.
Consider what you want to learn or discuss with the question.
Craft a clear and concise question that sparks curiosity or debate.
Ensure the question is relevant to your audience and fits the overall tone of your podcast.
Review and refine the question to make it engaging and thought-provoking.
